metadata.Title: CVE-2017-9120 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
PHP 7.x through 7.1.5 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (buffer overflow and application crash) or possibly have unspecified other impact via a long string because of an Integer overflow in mysqli_real_escape_string.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-9120` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libapache2-mod-php7.2 - 7.2.24-0ubuntu0.18.04.11
libphp7.2-embed - 7.2.24-0ubuntu0.18.04.11
php7.2 - 7.2.24-0ubuntu0.18.04.11
php7.2-bcmath - 7.2.24-0ubuntu0.18.04.11

notes.Note: leosilva> unfixed upstream as of 2020-10-05 rodrigo-zaiden> php7.0 retriage on 2022-02-01 found that upstream fixed it on 2021-08-09, information is now updated to reflect this.

criterions.comment: php7.2 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '7.2.24-0ubuntu0.18.04.11').
